cleanSlate.name: Pennsylvania Clean Slate Law
cleanSlate.description: Pennsylvania's Clean Slate law provides automatic sealing of certain criminal records without requiring individuals to file a petition. The 2023 expansion significantly broadened eligibility.

automaticSealing.processTime: The automated system processes records on a rolling basis
automaticSealing.note: Automatic sealing occurs without any action required by the individual

automaticSealingCriteria.summaryOffenses: 5 years from conviction or final discharge
automaticSealingCriteria.misdemeanors: 10 years from final discharge of sentence

primaryStatutes.title: Expungement and Clean Slate Law
primaryStatutes.description: Primary statute governing both petition-based expungement and automatic record sealing in Pennsylvania

eligibility: Successful completion of ARD (Accelerated Rehabilitative Disposition)
Summary offenses after 5 years with no further convictions

b1.description: Clean Slate automatic sealing for non-convictions
b1.timing: Automatic - no waiting period for sealing

b2.description: Clean Slate automatic sealing for summary convictions
eligibility: No subsequent arrests during waiting period

b3.description: Clean Slate automatic sealing for misdemeanor convictions
eligibility: No subsequent arrests during waiting period

b3_1.description: Clean Slate automatic sealing for certain felony convictions (2023 expansion)
eligibility: No subsequent arrests during waiting period
exclusions: Crimes requiring registration under Megan's Law

eligibility: Underage drinking convictions under certain conditions
c.note: Petition-based expungement is separate from Clean Slate automatic sealing

primaryStatutes.title: Limited Access Records
primaryStatutes.description: Defines records that have been sealed but remain accessible to certain parties

nonConviction.description: Automatic sealing upon acquittal, dismissal, or withdrawal of charges

summaryOffense.description: Five years from conviction or final discharge, whichever is later
summaryOffense.condition: No subsequent arrests during the waiting period

misdemeanor.description: Ten years from final discharge of sentence
misdemeanor.condition: No subsequent arrests during the waiting period

nonViolentFelony.description: Ten years from final discharge of sentence (2023 expansion)
nonViolentFelony.condition: No subsequent arrests during the waiting period

ardCompletion.description: May petition for expungement upon successful ARD completion

underageDrinking.description: May petition after turning 21 if conviction was for underage drinking
underageDrinking.condition: No other convictions during the period

cleanSlateExclusions: Rape, sexual assault, or involuntary deviate sexual intercourse
Aggravated assault with a deadly weapon
Any offense requiring registration as a sex offender
Firearms not to be carried without a license
DUI (ineligible for automatic sealing, may petition in limited circumstances)
petitionExclusions: Most misdemeanor and felony convictions require Clean Slate
Petition-based expungement limited to specific categories

nonConvictions.description: All charges resulting in acquittal, dismissal, nolle prosequi, or withdrawal

summaryOffenses.description: Summary offenses become automatically sealed after 5 years

nonViolentFelonies.description: Certain non-violent felonies sealed after 10 years (2023 expansion)

ardProgram.description: ARD completions may be petitioned for expungement

sealing.description: Clean Slate provides record SEALING, not complete expungement
does: Removes from most employer background checks
Allows you to legally deny the conviction on most job applications
Removes from standard court records search
Removes from Pennsylvania State Police public records
doesNot: Remove records from law enforcement databases
Allow denial in certain regulated professions
Allow denial for jobs requiring FBI background checks
Remove records accessible to courts for sentencing

expungement.description: Full expungement destroys the record completely
expungement.availability: Limited to ARD completions, acquittals, and special categories

cleanSlate.description: Clean Slate automatic sealing is FREE - no filing or administrative fees

filingFee.note: Fees may be waived for indigent petitioners

cleanSlateHighlights: Pennsylvania was the FIRST state to pass automatic Clean Slate legislation (2018)
Over 30 million records sealed in the first three years
2023 expansion made PA law one of the most comprehensive in the nation
No cost to individuals - completely free automatic process
Includes certain non-violent felonies (rare in other states)
Process is automatic - no lawyer or paperwork required
